moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 Bg4 4. dxc5 Bxf: Wow! What a messy brawl thsi turned out to be.
moves.13. Rxd5: Now White looks like it is about to launch an unstoppable attack
moves.13... Qa5 14. a3 axb5: If I can secure my King and fend off the attack without losing the material advantage, I should take this game. I see counter-attacking possibilities
moves.15. Rhd1 Nc6 16. Qe4 Nge7 17. Rd5d7 Rb8: This looks like it is jsut to defend the Pawn on f, but it also initiates an attack.
moves.21. axb4 Bxb4: I figured he would move c2-c3 next. Then I would move the Bishop to e7 to drive his Queen away.
moves.22. Rd1d5: This was a surprise blunder. He forgot all about "what can he do to me" and went to "what can I do to him".
